title: Forinthry

properties.name: description
properties.value: Forinthry is an ancient name associated with the area now known as the Wilderness.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Forinthry

Forinthry is an ancient name associated with the area now known as the Wilderness.

History[edit | edit source]

The meaning of the word Forinthry was unknown for a long time. It was first referenced when the name of the Abyssal bracelet was changed to the Forinthry bracelet on RuneScape 3.

Forinthry is mentioned briefly by the Museum Curator in the Varrock Museum. He refers to several of the artefacts on display at the museum being related in one way or another to Forinthry. The Curator believes that Forinthry was once a great city, much like Varrock is today, and that it was destroyed during the God Wars. Forinthry is also mentioned by slayer masters when advising the player on how to slay revenants.

It is unknown how large the city of Forinthy was, or if it was a city at all. If it spanned the entirety of the modern-day Wilderness, it would be the largest city in Gielinor by far.

Armies of Gielinor[edit | edit source]

Forinthry is also referenced in the RuneScape-based FunOrb game, Armies of Gielinor. In the briefing for the second mission of the single-player campaign, "Guthix Awakens", one of the Sages of Guthix, Ewean, says that, "[The] land is condemned, all the way from Forinthry to Sophanem." Little information could be gleaned from this, other than the implication that it was far from Sophanem. Pushing this statement a little further, one could argue that Forinthry was on the opposite side of the continent in regards to Sophanem. This would imply it was located on the north coast of Gielinor, which is now part of the Wilderness.
rawContent:
{{External|rs}}
'''Forinthry''' is an ancient name associated with the area now known as the [[Wilderness]].

==History==
The meaning of the word ''Forinthry'' was unknown for a long time. It was first referenced when the name of the [[Abyssal bracelet]] was changed to the {{RSL|Forinthry bracelet}} on ''[[RuneScape 3]]''.

Forinthry is mentioned briefly by the [[Museum Curator]] in the [[Varrock Museum]]. He refers to several of the artefacts on display at the museum being related in one way or another to Forinthry. The Curator believes that Forinthry was once a great city, much like [[Varrock]] is today, and that it was destroyed during the [[God Wars]]. Forinthry is also mentioned by [[slayer master]]s when [[Slayer Task Tips|advising the player]] on how to slay [[revenant]]s.

It is unknown how large the city of Forinthy was, or if it was a city at all. If it spanned the entirety of the modern-day Wilderness, it would be the largest city in [[Gielinor]] by far.

===Armies of Gielinor===
Forinthry is also referenced in the ''RuneScape''-based [[rsw:FunOrb|FunOrb]] game, ''[[rsw:Armies of Gielinor|Armies of Gielinor]]''. In the briefing for the second mission of the single-player campaign, "Guthix Awakens", one of the Sages of [[Guthix]], Ewean, says that, "[The] land is condemned, all the way from Forinthry to [[Sophanem]]." Little information could be gleaned from this, other than the implication that it was far from Sophanem. Pushing this statement a little further, one could argue that Forinthry was on the opposite side of the continent in regards to Sophanem. This would imply it was located on the north coast of Gielinor, which is now part of the Wilderness.
